Events.html: 218 BC – Second Punic War: Battle of the Trebia – Hannibal's Carthaginian forces defeat those of the Roman Republic.
Events.text: Second Punic War: Battle of the Trebia – Hannibal's Carthaginian forces defeat those of the Roman Republic.

Events.html: 1271 – Kublai Khan renames his empire "Yuan" (元 yuán), officially marking the start of the Yuan dynasty of Mongolia and China.
Events.text: Kublai Khan renames his empire "Yuan" (元 yuán), officially marking the start of the Yuan dynasty of Mongolia and China.

Events.html: 1622 – Portuguese forces score a military victory over the Kingdom of Kongo at the Battle of Mbumbi in present-day Angola.
Events.text: Portuguese forces score a military victory over the Kingdom of Kongo at the Battle of Mbumbi in present-day Angola.

Events.html: 1655 – The Whitehall Conference ends with the determination that there was no law preventing Jews from re-entering England after the Edict of Expulsion of 1290.
Events.text: The Whitehall Conference ends with the determination that there was no law preventing Jews from re-entering England after the Edict of Expulsion of 1290.

Events.html: 1777 – The United States celebrates its first Thanksgiving, marking the recent victory by the Americans over British General John Burgoyne in the Battle of Saratoga in October.
Events.text: The United States celebrates its first Thanksgiving, marking the recent victory by the Americans over British General John Burgoyne in the Battle of Saratoga in October.

Events.html: 1787 – New Jersey becomes the third state to ratify the U.S. Constitution.
Events.text: New Jersey becomes the third state to ratify the U.S. Constitution.

Events.html: 1793 – Surrender of the frigate La Lutine by French Royalists to Lord Samuel Hood; renamed HMS Lutine, she later becomes a famous treasure wreck.
Events.text: Surrender of the frigate La Lutine by French Royalists to Lord Samuel Hood; renamed HMS Lutine, she later becomes a famous treasure wreck.

Events.html: 1867 – The Angola Horror train wreck occurred.
Events.text: The Angola Horror train wreck occurred.

Events.html: 1878 – John Kehoe, the last of the Molly Maguires is executed in Pennsylvania.
Events.text: John Kehoe, the last of the Molly Maguires is executed in Pennsylvania.

Events.html: 1878 – The Al-Thani family become the rulers of the state of Qatar
Events.text: The Al-Thani family become the rulers of the state of Qatar

Events.html: 1888 – Richard Wetherill and his brother in-law discover the ancient Indian ruins of Cliff Palace in Mesa Verde.
Events.text: Richard Wetherill and his brother in-law discover the ancient Indian ruins of Cliff Palace in Mesa Verde.

Events.html: 1892 – Premiere performance of The Nutcracker by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky in Saint Petersburg, Russia.
Events.text: Premiere performance of The Nutcracker by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky in Saint Petersburg, Russia.

Events.html: 1898 – Gaston de Chasseloup-Laubat sets the first officially recognized land speed record of 39.245 mph (63.159 km/h) in a Jeantaud electric car
Events.text: Gaston de Chasseloup-Laubat sets the first officially recognized land speed record of 39.245 mph (63.159 km/h) in a Jeantaud electric car

Events.html: 1900 – The Upper Ferntree Gully to Gembrook, Victoria Narrow-gauge (2 ft 6 in or 762 mm) Railway (now the Puffing Billy Railway) in Victoria, Australia is opened for traffic.
Events.text: The Upper Ferntree Gully to Gembrook, Victoria Narrow-gauge (2 ft 6 in or 762 mm) Railway (now the Puffing Billy Railway) in Victoria, Australia is opened for traffic.

Events.html: 1912 – The Piltdown Man, later discovered to be a hoax, is announced by Charles Dawson.
Events.text: The Piltdown Man, later discovered to be a hoax, is announced by Charles Dawson.

Events.html: 1916 – World War I: The Battle of Verdun ends when German forces under Chief of staff Erich von Falkenhayn are defeated by the French, and suffer 337,000 casualties.
Events.text: World War I: The Battle of Verdun ends when German forces under Chief of staff Erich von Falkenhayn are defeated by the French, and suffer 337,000 casualties.

Events.html: 1917 – The resolution containing the language of the Eighteenth Amendment to enact Prohibition is passed by the United States Congress.
Events.text: The resolution containing the language of the Eighteenth Amendment to enact Prohibition is passed by the United States Congress.

links.subject: Eighteenth Amendment
links.title: Eighteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.html: 1932 – The Chicago Bears defeat the Portsmouth Spartans in the first NFL Championship Game.
Events.text: The Chicago Bears defeat the Portsmouth Spartans in the first NFL Championship Game.

Events.html: 1935 – The Lanka Sama Samaja Party is founded in Ceylon.
Events.text: The Lanka Sama Samaja Party is founded in Ceylon.

Events.html: 1939 – World War II: The Battle of the Heligoland Bight, the first major air battle of the war, takes place.
Events.text: World War II: The Battle of the Heligoland Bight, the first major air battle of the war, takes place.

Events.html: 1944 – World War II: Seventy-seven B-29 Superfortress and 200 other aircraft of U.S. Fourteenth Air Force bomb Hankow, China, a Japanese supply base.
Events.text: World War II: Seventy-seven B-29 Superfortress and 200 other aircraft of U.S. Fourteenth Air Force bomb Hankow, China, a Japanese supply base.

Events.html: 1956 – Japan joins the United Nations.
Events.text: Japan joins the United Nations.

Events.html: 1958 – Project SCORE, the world's first communications satellite, is launched.
Events.text: Project SCORE, the world's first communications satellite, is launched.

Events.html: 1966 – Saturn's moon Epimetheus is discovered by Richard L. Walker.
Events.text: Saturn's moon Epimetheus is discovered by Richard L. Walker.

Events.html: 1969 – Capital punishment in the United Kingdom: Home Secretary James Callaghan's motion to make permanent the Murder (Abolition of Death Penalty) Act 1965, which had temporarily suspended capital punishment in England, Wales and Scotland for murder (but not for all crimes) for a period of five years.
Events.text: Capital punishment in the United Kingdom: Home Secretary James Callaghan's motion to make permanent the Murder (Abolition of Death Penalty) Act 1965, which had temporarily suspended capital punishment in England, Wales and Scotland for murder (but not for all crimes) for a period of five years.

links.subject: Capital punishment in the United Kingdom
links.title: Capital punishment in the United Kingdom

Events.html: 1971 – Capitol Reef National Park is established in Utah.
Events.text: Capitol Reef National Park is established in Utah.

Events.html: 1972 – Vietnam War: President Richard Nixon announces that the United States will engage North Vietnam in Operation Linebacker II, a series of Christmas bombings, after peace talks collapsed with North Vietnam on the 13th.
Events.text: Vietnam War: President Richard Nixon announces that the United States will engage North Vietnam in Operation Linebacker II, a series of Christmas bombings, after peace talks collapsed with North Vietnam on the 13th.

Events.html: 1973 – Soviet Soyuz Programme: Soyuz 13, crewed by cosmonauts Valentin Lebedev and Pyotr Klimuk, is launched from Baikonur in the Soviet Union.
Events.text: Soviet Soyuz Programme: Soyuz 13, crewed by cosmonauts Valentin Lebedev and Pyotr Klimuk, is launched from Baikonur in the Soviet Union.

Events.html: 1973 – The Islamic Development Bank is founded.
Events.text: The Islamic Development Bank is founded.

Events.html: 1978 – Dominica joins the United Nations.
Events.text: Dominica joins the United Nations.

Events.html: 1987 – Larry Wall releases the first version of the Perl programming language.
Events.text: Larry Wall releases the first version of the Perl programming language.

Events.html: 1989 – The European Economic Community and the Soviet Union sign an agreement on trade and commercial and economic cooperation.
Events.text: The European Economic Community and the Soviet Union sign an agreement on trade and commercial and economic cooperation.

Events.html: 1997 – HTML 4.0 is published by the World Wide Web Consortium.
Events.text: HTML 4.0 is published by the World Wide Web Consortium.

Events.html: 1999 – NASA launches into orbit the Terra platform carrying five Earth Observation instruments, including ASTER, CERES, MISR, MODIS and MOPITT.
Events.text: NASA launches into orbit the Terra platform carrying five Earth Observation instruments, including ASTER, CERES, MISR, MODIS and MOPITT.

links.subject: ASTER
links.title: Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer

links.subject: CERES
links.title: Clouds and the Earth's Radiant Energy System

Events.html: 2002 – 2003 California recall: Then Governor of California Gray Davis announces that the state would face a record budget deficit of $35 billion, roughly double the figure reported during his reelection campaign one month earlier.
Events.text: 2003 California recall: Then Governor of California Gray Davis announces that the state would face a record budget deficit of $35 billion, roughly double the figure reported during his reelection campaign one month earlier.

Events.html: 2005 – The Chadian Civil War begins when rebel groups, allegedly backed by neighbouring Sudan, launch an attack in Adré.
Events.text: The Chadian Civil War begins when rebel groups, allegedly backed by neighbouring Sudan, launch an attack in Adré.

Events.html: 2006 – The first of a series of floods strikes Malaysia. The death toll of all flooding is at least 118, with over 400,000 people displaced.
Events.text: The first of a series of floods strikes Malaysia. The death toll of all flooding is at least 118, with over 400,000 people displaced.

Events.html: 2006 – United Arab Emirates holds its first-ever elections.
Events.text: United Arab Emirates holds its first-ever elections.
